Upgrading Firmware Manually

 1. Choose Administration > Firmware/Language Upgrade.

 2. In the Manual Firmware/Language Upgrade section, click the Firmware Image radio button in the File Type field.

 3. To upgrade to the latest firmware version, choose one of the following options to upgrade from:

 • cisco.com—Download the firmware from the cisco.com website.

 • PC—Click Browse to locate and select the downloaded firmware on your computer.

 4. (Optional) To reset the device to default factory settings after the firmware is upgraded, check Reset all configurations/settings to factory defaults.

Caution Resetting the device to default factory settings erases all of your configuration settings.

 5. Click Start Upgrade.

After the new firmware image is validated, the new image is written to flash, and the device is automatically rebooted with the new firmware.

 6. Choose Status > System Summary to make sure the router installed the new firmware version.
